definition: to move (i.e. relocate oneself)/to move (sth relatively heavy or bulky)/to shift/to copy indiscriminately

home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: Stanely:I just moved and there is no public transportation available.
sentences.chinese: 我剛搬家，附近沒有大衆交通工具可搭。

sentences.english: Remember when I helped you move?Well, now I need you to return the favor.
sentences.chinese: 還記得我曾經幫過你搬家嗎？現在是你報恩的時候了。

sentences.english: I spent several months on decoration and arrangement the house.
sentences.chinese: 費了個把月的時間裝修佈置，終於搬家了。

sentences.english: The months went by quickly while I busied myself with preparation for the move.
sentences.chinese: 之後，我整天忙於搬家的事，幾個月飛快地過去了。

sentences.english: Please forward our post to our new home when we move.
sentences.chinese: 我們搬家後，請將郵件轉遞到我們的新住處。

sentences.english: I moved becasue I can't put up with that officious landlady any longer.
sentences.chinese: 我搬家是因爲我再也受不了那個好管閒事的女房東了。

sentences.english: It was nearly dark by the time the removal vans left.
sentences.chinese: 當搬家卡車離開時天已幾乎昏暗了。

sentences.english: Thank you for helping us move.You were a big help.
sentences.chinese: 謝謝您幫我們搬家，這可幫了我們一個大忙。

sentences.english: I'am intending to transact phone moving procedure for I've moved.
sentences.chinese: 我搬家了，因此想辦理移機手續。

sentences.english: If you live in an area vulnerable to landslides, consider leaving it.
sentences.chinese: 如果你生活在滑坡高危區，考慮搬家吧。

sentences.english: But since we moved I just cook and clean.
sentences.chinese: 但是自從我們搬家，我只做飯和搞衛生。

sentences.english: I moved because I can't put up with that officious landlady any longer.
sentences.chinese: 我搬家是因爲我再也受不了那個好管閒事的女房東了。

sentences.english: If they try to know more, it's a notice to quit.
sentences.chinese: 如果他們再想根究別的什麼，那就等於通知我搬家。

sentences.english: Would you move acro the country or abroad for your dream job?
sentences.chinese: 你願意爲了理想的工作而搬家甚或搬到國外嗎？

sentences.english: Moving vans, all sorts of things of that nature.
sentences.chinese: 還有搬家汽車等等同類事件。

sentences.english: I move house to a apartment on Sengkang subway station.
sentences.chinese: 我們搬家了，我們搬到了盛港地鐵站上放的公寓。

definition: to move (i.e. relocate oneself)/to move (sth relatively heavy or bulky)/to shift/to copy indiscriminately
to go back to one's roots/to return to one's native place/by ext. to join one's ancestors (i.e. to die)
to demolish a building and relocate the inhabitants
to go on an official or business trip
congratulations on house-moving or promotion (idiom); Best wishes for your new home!
to hire/to rent/to charter/to rent out/to lease out/rent/land tax
to check in (at a hotel etc)
to rent jointly with other people/co-renting
rent for a room or house
